text: What does Azure Blob Storage store?
What level is read/write control implemented in the following path: AzureStorageAccount1/BlobContainer/folder1/blob1

options.text: Stores blocks up to 10MB, can contain up to 100,000 blocks, maximum size of 4.7GB
Stores blocks up to 100MB, can contain up to 50,000 blocks, maximum size of 4.7TB
Stores blocks up to 100MB, can contain up to 500 blocks, maximum size of 4.7MB
Stores blocks up to 10GB, can contain up to 5,000 blocks, maximum size of 4.7TB

text: What type of blob is best for storing discrete, large, binary objects that change infrequently?

options.text: A push/pop only block blob with blocks up to 4MB and max size up to 195GB
A block blob with blocks up to 4MB and max size up to 195GB
A push/pop only block blob with blocks up to 100MB and max size up to 4.7TB
A block blob with blocks up to 100MB and max size up to 4.7TB
A push/pop only block blob with blocks up to 4MB and max size up to 195GB

text: Which access tier(s) require(s) rehydrating before becoming accessible?
How can you automatically move blobs between tiers as they age?
Which service is integrated into Azure Storage?
What must you do to create an Azure Data Lake Store (Gen2) files system?

options.text: Disable the Hierarchical Namespace option of an Azure Storage Account
Create an Azure Blob Store in an Azure Storage Account
Migrate blobs from Azure Data Lake Store (Gen1)
Enable the Hierarchical Namespace option of an Azure Storage Account
